coverage_summary: Landlord's Buildings and Contents Insurance designed to provide cover for loss or damage to rental property, including buildings and landlord's contents, with liability coverage and optional legal expenses.
key_inclusions: Loss or damage by fire, explosion, lightning, earthquake, storm, flood, riot, malicious persons, subsidence
Escape of water (e.g. burst pipes or tanks) or oil
Theft, collision by vehicles or animals
Collapse of aerials and falling trees
Accidental breakage of mirrors, fixed glass in furniture, ceramic hobs and audio/audio visual equipment
Accidental damage to underground pipes and cables
Accidental breakage of fixed glass in windows, fixed ceramic hobs and fixed sanitary ware
Landlord's contents in gardens and garages/outbuildings
Alternative accommodation or loss of rent
Accidental loss of metered water and domestic heating oil
Loss or damage to carpets, curtains and white goods by causes 1-11
key_exclusions: Any loss or damage caused gradually or by wear & tear, depreciation, effects of light or atmosphere
Mould, dry or wet rot or fungus
Costs from normal use, maintenance and upkeep of buildings and landlord's contents
Loss or damage after property becomes unoccupied caused by malicious people, escape of water, escape of oil or theft
Electrically or mechanically propelled or assisted vehicles and any liability arising from them
Accidental damage to landlord's contents by chewing, scratching, tearing, fouling or urinating by domestic animals
Loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood
Mechanical or electrical breakdown or failure (unless optional cover purchased)
Damage caused by or in the process of cleaning, maintenance, repair, dismantling, restoring, altering dyeing or washing (unless optional cover purchased)
Loss or damage caused, or allowed to be caused, deliberately, wilfully, maliciously, illegally or unlawfully by policyholder
special_conditions: Property must not be unoccupied when damage occurs for certain perils (malicious people, escape of water, escape of oil, theft)
Property must be maintained in good repair
Precautions must be taken to avoid injury, loss or damage
Property must be safeguarded from loss or damage
Must inform insurer of changes including address changes, structural alterations, change of use, unoccupancy, bankruptcy, or criminal matters
Premium must be paid on time
For Legal Expenses: Must notify claims within 180 days of becoming aware of incident
Must gain consent before incurring legal advisers' costs
excess_deductible: Excess amounts apply to each claim as listed in policy schedule; amounts vary depending on voluntary excess choices
geographical_coverage: United Kingdom for main policy; United Kingdom, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and European Union for Legal Expenses claims
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling-off period from receipt of policy documents (new business or renewal); full refund if cover has not started; pro-rata refund if cover has started and no claims have occurred; can cancel at any time by written notice with pro-rata refund if no claims made; no refund if claims have been made

endorsements.name: Additional Accidental Damage to Landlord's Contents
endorsements.description: Extends cover to include: mechanical or electrical breakdown or failure; damage caused by or in the process of cleaning, maintenance, repair, dismantling, restoring, altering, dyeing or washing; accidental damage or loss to landlord's contents while in private residence; accidental damage to landlord's contents in garage or outbuilding up to £1,000
endorsements.coverage_impact: Removes exclusions for mechanical/electrical breakdown and damage during maintenance/cleaning processes

endorsements.name: Additional Accidental Damage to Buildings
endorsements.description: Provides accidental damage to the buildings up to the buildings sum insured; includes damage arising from faulty workmanship or defective design or use of defective materials; damage caused by alteration or extension of the buildings
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends buildings cover to include accidental damage and damage from faulty workmanship/defective materials

endorsements.name: Legal Expenses
endorsements.description: Provided by Arc Legal Assistance Limited (FCA 305958); covers legal advisers' costs for Property Infringement (nuisance or trespass) and Criminal Prosecution Defence under specific safety regulations (Gas Safety, Furniture Fire Safety, Electrical Equipment Safety)
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds legal defense coverage for specific regulatory prosecutions and property rights infringement

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible; for Legal Expenses within 180 days of becoming aware of the insured incident
required_documents: All relevant information about the claim to assist in validation
Information requested by legal adviser (for Legal Expenses)
process_steps: Notify AXA of the claim as soon as possible
Provide all relevant information to assist validation
Take steps to prevent further damage
Do not dispose of damaged items
Do not conduct permanent repairs before inspection
For Legal Expenses: Supply information at own expense to decide claim acceptance
For Legal Expenses: Gain consent before incurring legal advisers' costs
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Must not dispose of damaged items or conduct permanent repairs as insurer may need to inspect damage; must supply all information requested by adviser and insurer
claims_requirements.claims_contact: AXA Personal Lines Customer Service, PO Box 7072, Willenhall, WV1 9ZU

eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Property must be private residences in the United Kingdom; must be let for private residential purposes
other_restrictions: Property must not be used for any reason other than private residential purposes
Must inform if policyholder or family has been declared bankrupt
Must inform if policyholder or family has received police caution or been convicted or charged with any offence
Property must not be left unoccupied for extended periods (specific definition in policy booklet)

policy_definitions.unoccupied: See policy booklet for complete definition; relates to property being empty/vacant for extended period
policy_definitions.vehicles_and_craft: See policy booklet for complete definition; includes electrically or mechanically propelled or assisted vehicles and watercraft
policy_definitions.private_residence: Property let for private residential purposes in the United Kingdom
policy_definitions.excess: Amount policyholder must pay for each claim
policy_definitions.buildings_sum_insured: Total amount of insurance selected for buildings coverage (£50,000 to £1,000,000)
policy_definitions.landlord_contents_sum_insured: Total amount of insurance selected for landlord's contents (£5,000 to £60,000)
policy_definitions.causes_1-11: Specific perils listed in policy booklet covering fire, explosion, lightning, earthquake, storm, flood, riot, malicious persons, subsidence, escape of water/oil, theft, collision, collapse of aerials, falling trees

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: Nuisance or trespass claims not covered within first 180 days of insurance starting
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Must notify Legal Expenses claims within 180 days of becoming aware of insured incident; general claims should be notified as soon as possible
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Legal Expenses claims must be notified within no more than 180 days of awareness
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from receipt of policy documents (new business or renewal) to cancel with full or pro-rata refund

common_questions.question: What is the maximum buildings sum insured I can select?
common_questions.answer: You can select your buildings sum insured between £50,000 and £1,000,000

common_questions.question: What is the maximum landlord's contents sum insured?
common_questions.answer: You can select your landlord's contents sum insured between £5,000 and £60,000

common_questions.question: Am I covered if the property is empty?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or damage occurring after the property has been unoccupied caused by malicious people, escape of water, escape of oil or theft is not covered

common_questions.question: Is damage by tenants' pets covered?
common_questions.answer: No, accidental damage to landlord's contents by chewing, scratching, tearing, fouling or urinating by domestic animals is excluded

common_questions.question: Are fences covered for storm damage?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood is specifically excluded

common_questions.question: How much time do I have to cancel after receiving the policy?
common_questions.answer: You have 14 days from receipt of policy documents to cancel, with full refund if cover hasn't started or pro-rata refund if it has (provided no claims)
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract - page 3

common_questions.question: What liability coverage is included?
common_questions.answer: Property owner's liability up to £2,000,000, public liability up to £2,000,000, and employer's liability up to £10,000,000

common_questions.question: Is alternative accommodation covered if tenants need to move out?
common_questions.answer: Yes, alternative accommodation or loss of rent is covered up to 20% of the buildings sum insured

common_questions.question: Can I get accidental damage cover?
common_questions.answer: Yes, optional covers are available for additional accidental damage to both landlord's contents and buildings

common_questions.question: How quickly must I report a Legal Expenses claim?
common_questions.answer: You must notify Legal Expenses claims as soon as possible and within no more than 180 days of becoming aware of the insured incident

common_questions.question: Will I get a refund if I cancel mid-term?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you will receive a pro-rata refund for the unused period, provided no claims have been made. If claims have been made, no refund is provided
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract - page 3

common_questions.question: What changes must I notify the insurer about?
common_questions.answer: Change of address, structural alterations, if property will no longer be let, change of use, if property becomes unoccupied, bankruptcy, police cautions or criminal convictions
